text: All lined up for debate programme on #bbcpoliticsnorth on Sunday April 28.
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: Sunday Politics this week: Brexit mess, who’s to blame, what next; Tyne & Wear Metro expansion & road charges; have mayors been better than council leaders, and cash for coastal communities. Guests: North Tyneside Conservative Judith Wallace, @bphillipsonMP and @MartinGannon002
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: This is significant. One of our councils saying it effectively does not trust the local force’s investigation of the previous Labour administration’s running of investment company Arch. But not sure whether there’s any chance of another investigation.
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: If you’re following the correct post-vote procedure, I’m assuming you’ll now spend the next three years deliberating on how to watch Sideways, consider re-opening the vote, then blame everyone else if you can’t make the DVD work.
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: Berwick MP on why she won’t be backing the PM’s deal as her constituents are relaxed about leaving the EU next week with no deal...
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: South Shields MP is one Labour member who has at least entertained the idea of voting for the PM’s deal in preference to no deal or no Brexit. Sounds like Downing St speech has not exactly hit the spot. A reminder - the next vote on a deal will be by MPs not the public.
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: That's all clear then...
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: Official Labour statement: "The Labour Party takes all complaints of sexual harassment extremely seriously, which are fully investigated and any appropriate disciplinary action is taken in line with Party rules and procedures."
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: The Labour Party says an allegation of sexual harassment by Jarrow MP Stephen Hepburn is being investigated. It's understood it dates back to 2005. It had previously been investigated by the party, but new witness testimony is understood to have come to light.
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: Berwick MP on Seema Malhotra's #PMQ referrring to a threat made to her last week. A threat made apparently "in jest".
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: Apologies Anne-Marie. Awkward phrasing by me.
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: Labour MP Seema Malhotra raises behaviour of unknown Conservative MP who its claimed threatened to chloroform a colleague and drag her through the lobbies to vote for PM's deal. (The threatened MP wasn't named in question but this was a story told by @annietrev last week). #PMQs
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: PM says more money is going into schools, but says the best solution for families is a strong economy and people in work, and says that's why its pleasing to see this week's record employment figures.
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: City of Durham's @robertabwMP raises case of her school in her constituency where poverty is so bad, teachers are sourcing food, clothes and shoes for children. Asks the PM to act as families are being "brought to their knees." #PMQs
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: Looking at that too Ricky.
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: Planning to look at the west end of Newcastle too Davey. You make a good point.
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: No.
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: If you want detail I've got it Alf! On the latest available stats 877,000 of those employed in the North East were full time workers, 317,000 part time and 57,000 in temporary work. 41,000 - 3.4% of the workforce - in Feb 2019 - estimated to be on zero hour contracts.
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: Graph showing the drop in unemployment on the last quarter by region. North East - jointly with London - had the second largest decrease in this set of figures. North West saw the biggest fall, Yorkshire the biggest rise.
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: Latest figures show employment in the North East up slightly both on the last quarter and on this time last year. The rate of 72.5% though remains lower than any other part of the UK, other than Northern Ireland.
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: The latest employment figures show a rise in people employed in the public sector. But the figures show it's being driven by a record high in people working for national government, as local government employment is at a record low. Graph shows marked decline since 2010.
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: We're looking at the need for transport investment in Tyneside and Wearside on #bbcpoliticsnorth this week. I'm particularly keen to talk to someone who commutes from Washington to Tyneside who'd welcome a chance to use a metro extension. Get in touch if you're that person!
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: Unemployment in the North East fell by 4,000 to 65,000 between November and January. The rate of 5.1% isn't the country's highest this quarter as Yorkshire & Humber saw its rate rise to 5.2%.
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: Barbara McGovern has paid £25,000 to get access to the drug Kuvan to help her son Archie manage his #pku. You can see her and her MP @LizTwistMP on why they want the NHS to change its guidelines on drugs for rare conditions on @BBCLN at 6,30pm.
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: Gateshead's MP re the Speaker's ruling says it's Erskine May wot won it...
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: Newcastle North MP on Speaker's ruling. Making the deal subject to a referendum probably would be a substantial change, but would the PM propose it and would MPs back it?
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: Penrith and the Border MP on what he makes of the Speaker's ruling on whether MV3 has to change before it can be put... But as it stands currently we may not be dropping back to the status quo though. Legislation still there committing UK to leaving on March 29.
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: Suspect this might cause the odd ruction: Speaker rules out Brexit vote on same motion - BBC News
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: Hello Col, Conservative guest - Peter Gibson - very much backs Brexit and backed Leave in the referendum. He is now supporting the PM's deal, which perhaps you don't, but he is a leaver.
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: Thanks Barbara. If you could follow me on Twitter, it might be easier as I can send you private messages.
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: Happy to point people towards a link Barbara. Can I check one detail - how old is Archie now?
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: Hello Barbara. Just to let you know, I am also putting together a piece for Look North tonight on Kuvan and Liz Twist's debate, including sections of your interview again.
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: From around 10.50 in, you can hear South Shields MP @EmmaLewellBuck tell @JonnyDymond why she might feel forced to vote for Theresa May’s deal if it comes down to A choice between the PM’s deal, no deal or no Brexit.
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: As ever Sunday Politics interested in your view last on what we’ll discuss at 11. #bbcpoliticsnorth
author: BBCRichardMoss

text: Sunday Politics at 11: Whitehaven coal mine plans - 500 jobs v environmental concerns; is NHS denying life-changing treatments to people with rare conditions; Brexit -is there a compromise?With @LizTwistMP, Darlington Conservative Peter Gibson and Jill Perry from @TheGreenParty
author: BBCRichardMoss
